configuration.description: Discord Bot OAuth Token Revoke URL
configuration.name: OAuth Token Revoke URL

configuration.description: Discord Bot OAuth Token Refresh URL
configuration.name: OAuth Token Refresh URL
Bot Token NOTE: Must be in the format "Bot <BOT_TOKEN>"

configuration.description: Discord Bot Max Page Size (or limit)
configuration.name: Max Page Size (or limit)
Event Notification Signature Key
configuration.description: Discord Bot Event Notification Signature Key

configuration.name: Event Notification Basic User Name
configuration.description: Discord Bot Event Notification Basic User Name

configuration.name: Event Notification Basic Password
configuration.description: Discord Bot Event Notification Basic Password

configuration.name: Default select fields
configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings
Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses
configuration.name: Filter null values from the response
Time of Getting Token or Performing Authentication
configuration.description: Discord Bot Time of Getting Token or Performing Authentication

configuration.name: Event Notification Callback URL
configuration.description: Discord Bot Event Notification Callback URL

configuration.name: Event Notification Instance Finder
configuration.description: Discord Bot This helps find all instances pertaining to an incoming event. The EVENT_NOTIFICATION_INSTANCE_FINDER is composed of two values, in the form "[INSTANCE_CONFIG_PROPERTY_KEY]|[JSON_PATH_TO_PROPERTY_VALUE]". The first value, INSTANCE_CONFIG_PROPERTY_KEY, is the element config key that we will use to determine which instances this event pertains to.  The second value, JSON_PATH_TO_PROPERTY_VALUE, is the JSON XPath to the event JSON that we will use to lookup the instances.  For example, GitHub sends the organization name back in their response, and we save this element config value as "github.organization", so the instance finder for GitHub would be "github.organization|organization.login"

configuration.name: Event Notification Subscription ID
configuration.description: Discord Bot Event Notification Subscription ID

resources.description: Delete/Close Channel --- Delete a channel, or close a private message. Deleting a category does not delete its child channels; they will have their parent_id removed and a Channel Update Gateway event will fire for each of them. Returns a channel object on success. Fires a Channel Delete Gateway event.
Get Channel --- Get a channel by ID. Returns a channel object.

Modify Channel --- Update a channel's settings. Returns a channel on success, and a 400 BAD REQUEST on invalid parameters. Fires a Channel Update Gateway event. If modifying a category, individual Channel Update events will fire for each child channel that also changes. All JSON Params are optional.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- name	string	2-100 character channel name	All
 - position	integer	the position of the channel in the left-hand listing	All
 - topic	string	0-1024 character channel topic	Text
 - nsfw	boolean	whether the channel is nsfw	Text
 - rate_limit_per_user	integer	amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots, as well as users with the permission manage_messages or manage_channel, are unaffected	Text
 - bitrate	integer	the bitrate (in bits) of the voice channel; 8000 to 96000 (128000 for VIP servers)	Voice
 - user_limit	integer	the user limit of the voice channel; 0 refers to no limit, 1 to 99 refers to a user limit	Voice
 - permission_overwrites	array of overwrite objects	channel or category-specific permissions	All
 - parent_id	snowflake	id of the new parent category for a channel	Text, Voice

resources.description: Get Channel Invites --- Returns a list of invite objects (with invite metadata) for the channel. Only usable for guild channels.

Create Channel Invite --- Create a new invite object for the channel. Only usable for guild channels. All JSON parameters for this route are optional, however the request body is not. If you are not sending any fields, you still have to send an empty JSON object ({}). Returns an invite object.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- max_age	integer	duration of invite in seconds before expiry, or 0 for never. Defaults to 86400 (24 hours)
 - max_uses	integer	max number of uses or 0 for unlimited. Defaults to 0
 - temporary	boolean	whether this invite only grants temporary membership. Defaults to false
 - unique	boolean	if true, don't try to reuse a similar invite (useful for creating many unique one time use invites). Defaults to false

resources.description: Get Channel Messages --- Returns the messages for a channel. Returns an array of message objects on success. The before, after, and around keys are mutually exclusive, only one may be passed at a time.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: max number of messages to return (1-100). Default 50

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: get messages after this message ID

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: get messages before this message ID

parameters.name: around
parameters.description: get messages around this message ID

resources.description: Create Message --- Before using this endpoint, you must connect to and identify with a gateway at least once. Post a message to a guild text or DM channel. Returns a message object. Fires a Message Create Gateway event. See message formatting for more information on how to properly format messages. The maximum request size when sending a message is 8MB.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- content	string	the message contents (up to 2000 characters)
 - nonce	snowflake	a nonce that can be used for optimistic message sending
 - tts	boolean	true if this is a TTS (test to speech) message
 - file	file contents	the contents of the file being sent
 - embed	embed object	embedded rich content
 - payload_json	string	JSON encoded body of any additional request fields.

resources.description: Bulk Delete Messages --- Delete multiple messages in a single request. This endpoint can only be used on guild channels. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires multiple Message Delete Gateway events. Any message IDs given that do not exist or are invalid will count towards the minimum and maximum message count (currently 2 and 100 respectively). Additionally, duplicated IDs will only be counted once.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: - messages	array of snowflakes	an array of message ids to delete (2-100)

resources.description: Delete Message --- Delete a message. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Message Delete Gateway event.
Get Channel Message --- Returns a specific message in the channel. Returns a message object on success.
Edit Message --- Edit a previously sent message. You can only edit messages that have been sent by the current user. Returns a message object. Fires a Message Update Gateway event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- content	string	the new message contents (up to 2000 characters)
 - embed	embed object	embedded rich content

resources.description: Delete All Reactions --- Deletes all reactions on a message.

Get Reactions --- Get a list of users that reacted with this emoji. Returns an array of user objects on success. The before, after, and around keys are mutually exclusive, only one may be passed at a time.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: max number of users to return (1-100). Default 25.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: get users after this user ID

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: get users before this user ID

parameters.name: emoji
parameters.description: takes the form of name:id for custom guild emoji, or Unicode characters

resources.description: Delete Own Reaction --- Delete a reaction the current user has made for the message. Returns a 204 empty response on success.

parameters.name: emoji
parameters.description: takes the form of name:id for custom guild emoji, or Unicode characters

resources.description: Create Reaction --- Create a reaction for the message. emoji takes the form of name:id for custom guild emoji, or Unicode characters. Returns a 204 empty response on success.

parameters.name: emoji
parameters.description: takes the form of name:id for custom guild emoji, or Unicode characters

resources.description: Delete User Reaction -- Deletes another user's reaction. Returns a 204 empty response on success.

parameters.name: emoji
parameters.description: takes the form of name:id for custom guild emoji, or Unicode characters

resources.description: Delete Channel Permission --- Delete a channel permission overwrite for a user or role in a channel. Only usable for guild channels. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
Edit Channel Permissions --- Edit the channel permission overwrites for a user or role in a channel. Only usable for guild channels. Returns a 204 empty response on success.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- allow	integer	the bitwise value of all allowed permissions
 - deny	integer	the bitwise value of all disallowed permissions
 - type	string	"member" for a user or "role" for a role

resources.description: Get Pinned Messages --- Returns all pinned messages in the channel as an array of message objects.
Delete Pinned Channel Message --- Delete a pinned message in a channel. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
Add Pinned Channel Message --- Pin a message in a channel. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
Group DM Remove Recipient --- Removes a recipient from a Group DM
Group DM Add Recipient --- Adds a recipient to a Group DM using their access token

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- access_token	string	access token of a user that has granted your app the gdm.join scope
 - nick	string	nickname of the user being added

resources.description: Trigger Typing Indicator --- Post a typing indicator for the specified channel. Generally bots should not implement this route. However, if a bot is responding to a command and expects the computation to take a few seconds, this endpoint may be called to let the user know that the bot is processing their message. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Typing Start Gateway event.
Get Channel Webhooks --- Returns a list of channel webhook objects.
Create Webhook --- Create a new webhook. Returns a webhook object on success.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- name	string	name of the webhook (2-32 characters)
 - avatar	?avatar data string	image for the default webhook avatar

resources.description:
Create Guild --- Create a new guild. Returns a guild object on success. Fires a Guild Create Gateway event.
This endpoint can be used only by bots in less than 10 guilds. Assigning a channel to a channel category is not supported by this endpoint, i.e. a channel can't have the parent_id field.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- name	string	name of the guild (2-100 characters)
 - region	string	voice region id
 - icon	string	base64 128x128 jpeg image for the guild icon
 - verification_level	integer	verification level
 - default_message_notifications	integer	default message notification level
 - explicit_content_filter	integer	explicit content filter level
 - roles	array of role objects	new guild roles
 - channels	array of partial channel objects	new guild's channels

resources.description: Delete Guild --- Delete a guild permanently. User must be owner. Returns 204 No Content on success. Fires a Guild Delete Gateway event.
Get Guild --- Returns the guild object for the given id.

Modify Guild --- Modify a guild's settings. Returns the updated guild object on success. Fires a Guild Update Gateway event.
All parameters to this endpoint are optional

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- name	string	guild name
 - region	string	guild voice region id
 - verification_level	integer	verification level
 - default_message_notifications	integer	default message notification level
 - explicit_content_filter	integer	explicit content filter level
 - afk_channel_id	snowflake	id for afk channel
 - afk_timeout	integer	afk timeout in seconds
 - icon	string	base64 128x128 jpeg image for the guild icon
 - owner_id	snowflake	user id to transfer guild ownership to (must be owner)
 - splash	string	base64 128x128 jpeg image for the guild splash (VIP only)
 - system_channel_id	snowflake	the id of the channel to which system messages are sent

resources.description: Get Guild Bans --- Returns a list of ban objects for the users banned from this guild.
Remove Guild Ban --- Remove the ban for a user. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Guild Ban Remove Gateway event.
Get Guild Ban --- Returns a ban object for the given user or a 404 not found if the ban cannot be found.
Create Guild Ban --- Create a guild ban, and optionally delete previous messages sent by the banned user. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Guild Ban Add Gateway event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- delete-message-days?	integer	number of days to delete messages for (0-7)
 - reason?	string	reason for the ban

resources.description: Get Guild Channels --- Returns a list of guild channel objects.

Modify Guild Channel Positions --- Modify the positions of a set of channel objects for the guild. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires multiple Channel Update Gateway events.
Only channels to be modified are required, with the minimum being a swap between at least two channels. This endpoint takes a JSON array of parameters in the following format:

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
This endpoint takes a JSON array of parameters in the following format:
 - id	snowflake	channel id
 - position	integer	sorting position of the channel

resources.description: Create Guild Channel --- Create a new channel object for the guild. Returns the new channel object on success. Fires a Channel Create Gateway event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- name	string	channel name (2-100 characters)
 - type	integer	the type of channel
 - topic	string	channel topic (0-1024 characters)
 - bitrate	integer	the bitrate (in bits) of the voice channel (voice only)
 - user_limit	integer	the user limit of the voice channel (voice only)
 - rate_limit_per_user	integer	amount of seconds a user has to wait before sending another message (0-21600); bots, as well as users with the permission manage_messages or manage_channel, are unaffected
 - position	integer	sorting position of the channel
 - permission_overwrites	array of overwrite objects	the channel's permission overwrites
 - parent_id	snowflake	id of the parent category for a channel
 - nsfw	boolean	whether the channel is nsfw

resources.description: Get Guild Embed --- Returns the guild embed object.
Modify Guild Embed --- Modify a guild embed object for the guild. All attributes may be passed in with JSON and modified. Returns the updated guild embed object.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
enabled boolean whether the embed is enabled
channel_id integer the embed channel id

resources.description: List Guild Emojis --- Returns a list of emoji objects for the given guild.
Create Guild Emoji --- Create a new emoji for the guild. Returns the new emoji object on success. Fires a Guild Emojis Update Gateway event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- name	string	name of the emoji
 - image	base64 image data	the 128x128 emoji image
 - roles	array of snowflakes	roles for which this emoji will be whitelisted

resources.description: Delete Guild Emoji --- Delete the given emoji. Returns 204 No Content on success. Fires a Guild Emojis Update Gateway event.
Get Guild Emoji --- Returns an emoji object for the given guild and emoji IDs
Modify Guild Emoji --- Modify the given emoji. Returns the updated emoji object on success. Fires a Guild Emojis Update Gateway event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- name	string	name of the emoji
 - roles	array of snowflakes	roles to which this emoji will be whitelisted

resources.description: Get Guild Integrations --- Returns a list of integration objects for the guild.
Create Guild Integration --- Attach an integration object from the current user to the guild. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Guild Integrations Update Gateway event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- type	string	the integration type
 - id	snowflake	the integration id

resources.description: Delete Guild Integration -- Delete the attached integration object for the guild. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Guild Integrations Update Gateway event.
Modify Guild Integration --- Modify the behavior and settings of an integration object for the guild. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Guild Integrations Update Gateway event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- expire_behavior	integer	the behavior when an integration subscription lapses (see the integration object documentation)
 - expire_grace_period	integer	period (in seconds) where the integration will ignore lapsed subscriptions
 - enable_emoticons	boolean	whether emoticons should be synced for this integration (twitch only currently)

resources.description: Sync Guild Integration --- Sync an integration. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
Get Guild Invites --- Returns a list of invite objects (with invite metadata) for the guild.

List Guild Members --- Returns a list of guild member objects that are members of the guild.
All parameters to this endpoint are optional

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: the highest user id in the previous page. Defaults to 0

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: max number of members to return (1-1000). Defaults to 1

resources.description: Modify Current User Nick --- Modifies the nickname of the current user in a guild. Returns a 200 with the nickname on success. Fires a Guild Member Update Gateway event.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: - nick	string	value to set users nickname to

resources.description: Remove Guild Member --- Remove a member from a guild. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Guild Member Remove Gateway event.
Get Guild Member --- Returns a guild member object for the specified user.

Modify Guild Member --- Modify attributes of a guild member. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Guild Member Update Gateway event. If the channel_id is set to null, this will force the target user to be disconnected from voice.
All parameters to this endpoint are optional.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- nick	string	value to set users nickname to
 - roles	array of snowflakes	array of role ids the member is assigned
 - mute	boolean	whether the user is muted in voice channels. Will throw a 400 if the user is not in a voice channel
 - deaf	boolean	whether the user is deafened in voice channels. Will throw a 400 if the user is not in a voice channel
 - channel_id	?snowflake	id of channel to move user to (if they are connected to voice)

resources.description: Add Guild Member --- Adds a user to the guild, provided you have a valid oauth2 access token for the user with the guilds.join scope. Returns a 201 Created with the guild member as the body, or 204 No Content if the user is already a member of the guild. Fires a Guild Member Add Gateway event. All parameters to this endpoint except for access_token are optional.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- access_token	string	an oauth2 access token granted with the guilds.join to the bot's application for the user you want to add to the guild	
 - nick	string	value to set users nickname to
 - roles	array of snowflakes	array of role ids the member is assigned
 - mute	boolean	whether the user is muted in voice channels
 - deaf	boolean	whether the user is deafened in voice channels

resources.description: Remove Guild Member Role --- Removes a role from a guild member. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Guild Member Update Gateway event.
Add Guild Member Role --- Adds a role to a guild member. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Guild Member Update Gateway event.
Get Guild Prune Count --- Returns an object with one 'pruned' key indicating the number of members that would be removed in a prune operation.

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: number of days to count prune for (1 or more)

resources.description: Begin Guild Prune --- Begin a prune operation. Returns an object with one 'pruned' key indicating the number of members that were removed in the prune operation. For large guilds it's recommended to set the compute_prune_count option to false, forcing 'pruned' to null. Fires multiple Guild Member Remove Gateway events.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- days	integer	number of days to prune (1 or more)
 - compute_prune_count	boolean	whether 'pruned' is returned, discouraged for large guilds

resources.description: Get Guild Voice Regions --- Returns a list of voice region objects for the guild. Unlike the similar /voice route, this returns VIP servers when the guild is VIP-enabled.
Get Guild Roles --- Returns a list of role objects for the guild.

Modify Guild Role Positions -- Modify the positions of a set of role objects for the guild. Returns a list of all of the guild's role objects on success. Fires multiple Guild Role Update Gateway events.
This endpoint takes a JSON array of parameters in the following format:

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- id	snowflake	role
 - position	integer	sorting position of the role

resources.description: Create Guild Role --- Create a new role for the guild. Returns the new role object on success. Fires a Guild Role Create Gateway event. All JSON params are optional.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- name	string	name of the role. Defaults to "new role"
 - permissions	integer	bitwise value of the enabled/disabled permissions. Defaults to @everyone permissions in guild
 - color	integer	RGB color value. Defaults to 0
 - hoist	boolean	whether the role should be displayed separately in the sidebar. Defaults to false
 - mentionable	boolean	whether the role should be mentionable. Defaults to false

resources.description: Delete Guild Role --- Delete a guild role. Returns a 204 empty response on success. Fires a Guild Role Delete Gateway event.

Modify Guild Role --- Modify a guild role. Returns the updated role on success. Fires a Guild Role Update Gateway event.
All parameters to this endpoint are optional.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- name	string	name of the role
 - permissions	integer	bitwise value of the enabled/disabled permissions
 - color	integer	RGB color value
 - hoist	boolean	whether the role should be displayed separately in the sidebar
 - mentionable	boolean	whether the role should be mentionable

resources.description: Get Guild Vanity URL --- Returns a partial invite object for guilds with that feature enabled. code will be null if a vanity url for the guild is not set.
Get Guild Webhooks --- Returns a list of guild webhook objects.
Get Guild Widget Image --- Returns a PNG image widget for the guild. The same documentation also applies to embed.png. All parameters for this endpoint are optional.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description:
style of the widget image returned (see below)
 - Widget Style Options
 - - shield	shield style widget with Discord icon and guild members online count
 - - banner1	large image with guild icon, name and online count. "POWERED BY DISCORD" as the footer of the widget
 - - banner2	smaller widget style with guild icon, name and online count. Split on the right with Discord logo
 - - banner3	large image with guild icon, name and online count. In the footer, Discord logo on the left and "Chat Now" on the right
 - - banner4	large Discord logo at the top of the widget. Guild icon, name and online count in the middle portion of the widget and a "JOIN MY SERVER" button at the bottom

resources.description: Delete Invite --- Delete an invite. Returns an invite object on success.
Get Invite --- Returns an invite object for the given code.

parameters.name: with_counts?
parameters.description: whether the invite should contain approximate member counts

resources.description: Get Current User --- Returns the user object of the requester's account.
Modify Current User --- Modify the requester's user account settings. Returns a user object on success.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- username	string	users username, if changed may cause the users discriminator to be randomized.
 - avatar	avatar data	if passed, modifies the user's avatar

resources.description: Create DM --- Create a new DM channel with a user. Returns a DM channel object.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: - recipient_id	snowflake	the recipient to open a DM channel with

resources.description: Get User Connections --- Returns a list of connection objects.
Get Current User Guilds  --- Returns a list of partial guild objects the current user is a member of.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: max number of guilds to return (1-100). Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: get guilds after this guild ID. Defaults to absent.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: get guilds before this guild ID. Defaults to absent.

resources.description: Leave Guild --- Leave a guild. Returns a 204 empty response on success.
Get User --- Returns a user object for a given user ID.
List Voice Regions --- Returns an array of voice region objects that can be used when creating servers.
Delete Webhook --- Delete a webhook permanently. User must be owner. Returns a 204 NO CONTENT response on success.
Get Webhook --- Returns the new webhook object for the given id.

Modify Webhook --- Modify a webhook. Returns the updated webhook object on success.
All parameters to this endpoint are optional

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- name	string	the default name of the webhook
 - avatar	avatar data string	image for the default webhook avatar
 - channel_id	snowflake	the new channel id this webhook should be moved to

resources.description: Delete Webhook with Token --- Same as above, except this call does not require authentication.
Get Webhook with Token --- Same as above, except this call does not require authentication and returns no user in the webhook object.
Modify Webhook with Token --- Same as above, except this call does not require authentication, does not accept a channel_id parameter in the body, and does not return a user in the webhook object.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
- name	string	the default name of the webhook
 - avatar	avatar data string	image for the default webhook avatar

resources.description: Execute Webhook

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
FIELD	TYPE	DESCRIPTION ? REQUIRED
 - content	string	the message contents (up to 2000 characters)	? one of content, file, embeds
 - username	string	override the default username of the webhook	? false
 - avatar_url	string	override the default avatar of the webhook	? false
 - tts	boolean	true if this is a TTS message	? false
 - file	file contents	the contents of the file being sent	? one of content, file, embeds
 - embeds	array of embed objects	embedded rich content	? one of content, file, embeds
 - payload_json	string	See message create	? multipart/form-data only
* ---For the webhook embed objects, you can set every field except type (it will be rich regardless of if you try to set it), provider, video, and any height, width, or proxy_url values for images.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response, and returns the created message body (defaults to false; when false a message that is not saved does not return an error)

resources.description: Execute GitHub-Compatible Webhook - Add a new webhook to your GitHub repo (in the repo's settings), and use this endpoint as the "Payload URL." You can choose what events your Discord channel receives by choosing the "Let me select individual events" option and selecting individual events for the new webhook you're configuring.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response (defaults to true; when false a message that is not saved does not return an error)

resources.description: Execute Slack-Compatible Webhook - Refer to Slack's documentation for more information. We (Discord) do not support Slack's channel, icon_emoji, mrkdwn, or mrkdwn_in properties.

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: waits for server confirmation of message send before response (defaults to true; when false a message that is not saved does not return an error)
